alert.note: Alert for Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 5:40PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Plumas, northeastern Tehama, northeastern Butte and southwestern Lassen Counties through 615 PM PDT... At 535 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking multiple strong thunderstorms from Quincy north to Chester, moving west-southwest at 10 mph, producing gusty outflow winds. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty outflow winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quincy, Chester, Mineral, East Quincy, Prattville, Storrie, Lake Almanor, Caribou, Twain, Canyondam, East Shore, Indian Falls, Tobin, Lake Almanor Country Club, Seneca, Belden, Lake Almanor Peninsula, Keddie, Mill Creek and Lake Almanor West. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
